original_conversation.content: Five years. [bitter] Five years of sixty-hour weeks, canceled vacations, and fighting for every single dollar just to keep the doors open. [upset] And they tell me this in an email? [furious] Not even a phone call, not even a meeting—just "due to recent funding reallocations, your position will be eliminated effective next month." [sarcastic] Very professional, thanks so much. [pause] [slowly] I built that teen mentorship program from nothing. [emotional] Twenty kids graduated last year because of what we— [voice breaking] because of what I created there. [sigh] [angry] But sure, let's just throw that away because some foundation board decided we're not, um... not trendy enough anymore. [very sad] God, I don't even know how to tell the staff. [anxious] They're already stretched so thin, and now they'll have to somehow cover everything I do with no director and probably no replacement because there's no money for one. [frustrated] That's the best part—they're not even hiring someone else. [bitter] They're just expecting everyone to magically absorb the work. [quietly] I should have seen this coming when they cut our grant by forty percent. [regretful] Should have started looking then, but I thought... I don't know, I thought we'd find a way. [exhausted] We always found a way before. [long pause] [very quietly] What am I supposed to do now?

subject: The nonprofit director position you've held for five years is being eliminated due to funding cuts
